results.title: Mitosis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows a mitosis actually taking place in a living cell. Demonstrates the effects of chemicals and radiation on dividing cells. Discusses the importance of mitosis to the growth and maintenance of an organism. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mitchell Newsreel Camera
results.credit_line: Lent by the Museum of Applied Arts and Sciences, Sydney. Gift of Ross Wood Productions, 1995.
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field. This model was an improved design on the earlier Mitchell cameras, which were widely used by film production companies as well as for news.

constellations_primary.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_primary.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field. Three-legged tripods made from firm materials like steel and wood helped steady the kind of image that was collected in production vans for Cinesound Productions and Movietone News. Designed and manufactured in Los Angeles, this model was an improved design on the earlier Mitchell cameras, which were widely used by film production companies like those at Pagewood Studios in Sydney, Australia. The Mitchell Newsreel Camera was a quieter alternative, making it less invasive on sets and in the field.

results.title: Misty
results.brief_description: Two young children living with their grandparents see a wild horse and they become enchanted. Like a dream, this horse runs with the wind and belongs to the wild. Obsessed with the thought of owning the horse, the children battle against all odds. When their dream comes true the horse will show them an adventure of love and freedom they had never thought possible.

results.title: Mistress = Maitresse (D)
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Losange, Pierre Andrieux and Barbet Schroeder
results.brief_description: Olivier (Gerard Depardieau), a petty thief who breaks into the flat of a young woman, Ariane, is startled to discover she is a dominatrix operating a lair devoted to sado-masochistic practices for an array of wealthy clients. Despite his bewilderment, Ariane and Olivier embark upon a tumultuous affair, complicated by her occupation, in which Olivier is occasionally involved. Perplexed and deeply in love, Olivier yearns to dissuade Ariane from her chosen life, the particulars of which fuel his burgeoning distrust of her. At times the film is blackly comic and wryly amusing, but it also contains some quite graphic scenes of sexual torture and a disconcerting depiction of a horse slaughter at an abattoir. Non-judgemental about Ariane and her clients’ desires, Barbet Schroeder (Reversal of fortune, Single white female, Barfly) examines love, lust, gender and bourgeois morality within the context of an unusual pairing of two people who seek to be together, despite their disparities. Warning: some scenes of sadistic and masochistic sex acts and violence may disturb some viewers. Costumes designed by Karl Lagerfeld. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Mister Whiskers: my favourite nursery rhymes
results.creator_credit: Franciscus Henri Productions, Franciscus Henri, Elizabeth Antheunis and Lindesay Dresden
results.brief_description: Join Mr Whiskers and his dog Smiggy in their garden for 48 of your favourite nursery rhymes. Including the following classics: Rock a bye baby; Here we go round the mulberry bush; Baa Baa black sheep; Hickory dickory dock; Hey diddle diddle; Three blind mice; Rub a dub dub; Miss Polly had a dolly; and, Three blind mice. Includes two bonus songs: Mister Whiskers monkey business and Clapping Land from the animated, ‘Hello Mister Whiskers’.

results.title: Mister Roberts
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Leland Hayward, John Ford and Mervyn LeRoy
results.brief_description: Hailed by critics as a classic of the American cinema, “Mister Roberts” is an adaptation of the smash hit Broadway play about life on a small naval cargo ship floating ‘somewhere between the Islands of Tedium and Ennui’ in the Pacific Ocean during World War II. Fonda is outstanding as the gentle cargo officer who protects his men from the shop’s tyrannical captain, played by James Cagney. Also in the cast is Jack Lemmon in his Academy Award winning role as Ensign Pulver and William Powell as Doc Daneeka.

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Robert Gordon Menzies
results.brief_description: Documents the life and political career of Sir Robert Menzies, Prime Minister of Australia during 1939-1941 and 1949-1966, shown in contemporary film scenes. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Joseph Benedict Chifley
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Tom Haydon
results.brief_description: The life and political career of J.B. Chifley, Prime Minister of Australia 1945-1949. Covers his early life and rise through the ranks of the ALP; notes the record amount of legislation passed furing his term of office, and presents interviews with associates. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary level.
